result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian David Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ian David Nelson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ian David Nelson was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Ian David Nelson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Ian David Nelson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All Counts concurrent.
Defendant to sign up for Probation in jail.
If Agent does not meet with him in jail, Defendant must report by Monday June 15, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant is signed up for Probation.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: all Counts

Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.

Concurrent with: all Counts

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CM106, 14CM255, 14CM566, 14CM567, 14CM574, 14CM601 , 14TR488 and 15CM77:
CO: RMW; REP: Drost; CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Francis D. Collins   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Ian David Nelson appeared.  Case called at 3:19 p.m. ADA Collins states resolution has been reached. No victims statements and no restitution requests. Gives recommendations. Atty Perrin in agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct's 1,2 and 3 in 15CM77 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct's 1,2 and 3 in 15CM77. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 4,5,6, and 7 in case 15CM77 and  cases 14CM106, 14CM255, 14CM566, 14CM567, 14CM574, 14CM601 and 14TR488 in their entirety. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:

-  S/W 1 year probation. 3 days conditional jail time. Sign up for probation in the jail. If probation agent does not meet with him in the jail, must report on Monday. Bond will continue until he signs up for probation

- Misdemeanor court costs

- Follow all rules and recommendations by the probation agent

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CM106, 14CM255, 14CM566, 14CM567, 14CM574, 14CM601, 14TR488, 15CM77:

ADA Nieskes states no speedy trial demand has been made. hml  Status conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by PD's Office. Re: appointment of counsel. km
Appointing Atty Perrin. km

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Jennifer Anne Bork,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Ian David Nelson appeared from jail. Court notes amended complaint filed adding Count 7. filed by ADA Matthew Hartung. eif
Pre-trial conference on February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Travel Centers of America or TA Truck Stop. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: G. Evenson, ADA:   Jennifer Anne Bork,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski for Joshua Hargrove,  DF:  Ian David Nelson appeared from jail.   Includes 15CM77 (Init), 14CM106, 14CM255, 14CM566, 14CM567, 14CM574 & 14CM601 (RW) & 14TR488 (PayH).  Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on 15CM77 Waives speedy trial. ADA Bork makes bond recommendations. Atty. Kucinski argues. Court notes 4 non appearances in court within the last year. Court reserves payments until next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
